epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_use: Concrete for construction applications including residential, commercial foundations, driveways, footpaths, high-rise buildings, dams, spillways, roads, bridges, public works infrastructure

classification.normal_class: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths
classification.special_class: High-strength/high-performance concrete, high durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural off-form finishes and decorative applications

product_description.dangerous_goods_classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to the Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail
product_description.hazardous_substances: None listed in the Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern for authorisation
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D
lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified (scope is cradle to delivery)

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight or m³ of concrete; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to and from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered via trucks and ships without packaging

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good to very good for all data sources
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: All data updated within 10 years as required by PCR 2019:14

system_boundaries.upstream_processes: Extraction, transport and manufacturing of raw materials; generation of electricity for modules A1 and A3
system_boundaries.core_processes: External transportation of materials, manufacturing of concrete (excluding mixing in truck), treatment of waste and wastewater
system_boundaries.downstream_processes: Distribution, installation, wastage, transport and treatment of waste at end of life

installation.activities_included: Pouring concrete from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation activities

deconstruction.method: Physical process of drilling and removing concrete using hydraulic excavator

transportation.purpose: Delivery to landfilling and reprocessing facility

end_of_life.notes: 100% of product assumed separately collected during deconstruction

carbonation_process.description: Natural absorption of CO2 by concrete over its lifetime through chemical reaction

allocation_method.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_method.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Economic allocation due to significant economic value
allocation_method.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data_source: AusLCI LCA database conforming to EN 15804
recycled_materials_handling.recycled_aggregate_use: Recycled aggregate from waste concrete can replace virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements
